revised_title: Ancient Trumpets and Antiquities Found in County Tyrone, Ireland
tldr: The author, Francis Nevill, describes the discovery of ancient brass trumpets and other artifacts in County Tyrone, Ireland. He speculates that these trumpets were used by pagan priests in funeral rites, as they were found alongside other gold artifacts with mysterious symbols. Nevill also discusses the poor man who found the artifacts, who sold them for a small amount of tobacco but later received a significant sum in Dublin.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
